content.text:
# Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Ending Sequence

| year = "You Only Live Once" by Wataru Hatano — Yuri on Ice (2017)
| holder = "Request" by Krage, storyboard and direction by Hiromu Ōshiro — Solo Leveling (2025)
| website =
| most_wins =
| most_nominations =
}}
The Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Ending Sequence is a music and sequence award given at the Crunchyroll Anime Awards since its inaugural edition in 2017. It is given for the best ending sequence in an anime series from the previous year. Winners are determined through a combined voting process by judges and public voting.
The ending sequence "You Only Live Once" composed by Wataru Hatano in Yuri on Ice first won the award in 2017. In the latest edition in 2025, "Request" composed by Krage in Solo Leveling won the award.
Winners and nominees
In the following list, the first titles listed in gold are the winners; those not in gold are nominees, which are listed in alphabetical order. The years given are those in which the ceremonies took place.
